Package com.iontrading.mkv

Class Mkv

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iontrading.mkv.Mkv
  • @Keep
@KeepPublicClassMembers
public class Mkv
extends Object
    Mkv is the entry-point class to all services offered by this API.
    See Also:
    start(), stop()

      • getAPIVersion

        public static int[] getAPIVersion()
        Returns an array of integers representing this API version.

        Version numbers are returned as exposed below:

        • Position 0: Major version
        • Position 1: Middle version
        • Position 2: Minor version
        • Position 3: Patch version
        Returns:
        an array of integers representing this API version

        public static Mkv start()
                 throws MkvException
        Initializes and starts the API services.
        Returns:
        a new Mkv object
        Throws:
        MkvException - if the services could not be started for a fatal error or if the API is already running.

                 throws MkvException
        Initializes and starts the API services.
        Parameters:
        qos - a MkvQoS configuration object
        Returns:
        a Mkv object
        Throws:
        MkvException - if the services could not be started for a fatal error or if the API is already running.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown​(MkvShutdownMode mode,
                     String message)
              throws MkvException
        Updates the "shutdown in progress" state of the component. The state becomes true if at least one registered platform listener requests it to be true. The shutdown in progress state can be updated only while handling a SHUTDOWN_REQUEST event.
        Parameters:
        mode - The shutdown mode of the component.
        message - The shutdown message of the component.
        Throws:
        MkvException - if this method is invoked out of the stack for the SHUTDOWN_REQUEST event handling.

      • currentTimeMillis

        public static double currentTimeMillis()
        Returns time since Epoch expressed in milliseconds with microsecond granularity
        Returns:
        The timestamp, as the difference, measured in milliseconds, between the current time and midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC; the fractional part of the delay provides microsecond granularity.
        See Also:
        MkvE2EDelaySampler

      • milliTime

        public static double milliTime()
        Returns the current value of the most precise available system timer, in milliseconds with microsecond granularity
        Returns:
        Returns the current value of the most precise available system timer, in milliseconds; the fractional part of the delay provides microsecond granularity. This method can only be used to measure elapsed time and is not related to any other notion of system or wall-clock time.

      • sysUtilsKind

        public static String sysUtilsKind()

      • sysNanoTimeKind

        public static String sysNanoTimeKind()

      • setReadinessProvider

        public void setReadinessProvider​(ReadinessProvider applicationReadinessProvider)
        Set the application provider for the readiness status. The handler is called whenever an external HTTP request comes to the mkv.monitor_port of this ION component requesting the /readiness end-point. The application is expected to return true if the business logic of the application is ready to function, false otherwise. In both cases, a JSON string can be provided to have additional insight about the readiness status of the application (e.g. showing the status of its internal and external dependencies).
        Parameters:
        applicationReadinessProvider - the application provider for the readiness status

        public static void main​(String[] commands)
